text: Janet Opal Asimov (née Jeppson; August 6, 1926 – February 25, 2019), usually written as J. O. Jeppson, was an American science fiction writer, psychiatrist, and psychoanalyst. She started writing science fiction in the 1970s. She was married to Isaac Asimov from 1973 until he died in 1992. They worked together on a lot of science fiction books for children. Some of these books were in the Norby series. She died in February 2019 at the age of 92.JANET ASIMOV Obituary at legacy.comsyfy.com obituary ==References== Category:American psychoanalysts Category:American science fiction writers Category:American psychiatrists Category:1926 births Category:2019 deaths
title: Janet Asimov
